channel.title: Book Review
channel.description: The world's top authors and critics join Sunday Book Review Editor Sam Tanenhaus in lively conversations about books, arts and ideas.
channel.itunes:author: The New York Times
channel.itunes:subtitle: The newest releases and literary trends.
channel.itunes:summary: The world's top authors and critics join Sunday Book Review Editor Sam Tanenhaus in lively conversations about books, arts and ideas.

item.itunes:author: Pamela Paul
item.title: Book Review Podcast: The Origins of World War I and More
item.description: This week, Harold Evans discusses two new books about the events leading up to World War I; Julie Bosman has notes from the field; Pamela Paul talks about the spring children’s books section; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

item.itunes:author: Pamela Paul
item.title: Book Review Podcast: Claire Messud and More
item.description: This week, Claire Messud discusses her new novel, “The Woman Upstairs”; Julie Bosman has notes from the field; Ramona Ausubel talks about her new short-story collection, “A Guide to Being Born”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

item.itunes:author: Pamela Paul
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Tom Perrotta talks about the letters of Willa Cather; Julie Bosman has notes from the field; Alexandra Starr discusses T. D. Allman’s “Finding Florida”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. John Williams is the host, filling in for Pamela Paul.

item.itunes:author: Pamela Paul
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Meg Wolitzer talks about her new novel, “The Interestings”; Rachel Shteir discusses three new books about Chicago; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Pamela Paul is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Sam Tanenhaus signs off as host, handing over the reins to Pamela Paul, the new editor of the Book Review, and hearing from past contributors.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Monte Reel talks about “Between Man and Beast”; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Ada Calhoun discusses Mike Piazza’s memoir; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Jonathan Sperber talks about his new biography of Karl Marx; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Parul Sehgal discusses Mohsin Hamid’s new novel, “How to Get Filthy Rich in Rising Asia”; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. John Williams is the host, filling in for Sam Tanenhaus.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Jamie Quatro talks about “I Want to Show You More”; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Carlene Bauer discusses “Frances and Bernard”; and Gregory Cowles has best-sellers news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Michael Moss talks about “Salt Sugar Fat”; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Jennifer Szalai discusses the fiction of Renata Adler; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.

item.itunes:author: Sam Tanenhaus
item.title: Book Review Podcast
item.description: This week, Jeanine Basinger discusses marriage in the movies; Leslie Kaufman has notes from the field; Charles McGrath talks about the letters of P. G. Wodehouse; and Gregory Cowles has best-seller news. Sam Tanenhaus is the host.
